duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate the efficient shipment of outbound orders using System 21 (S21) and check in truck drivers, assign trailers to a dock door.
Print, scan, procure signatures, distribute, and file shipment paperwork (BOL, packing list), and communicate with internal and external truck drivers to coordinate trailer loading.
Distribute tasks to union labor forklift crews and respond to schedule and carrier changes.
Evaluate inventory and coordinate product shipments from outside storage. Develop and implement distribution best practices and execute processes, reports, and data entry in S21.
Recommend S21 software improvements and ensure adherence to Personal Safety, Food Safety, Quality, and Environmental Policies and Practices.
Maintain inventory records, perform cycle counts and physical inventories, and ensure compliance with federal and state required labeling on cases before shipping.

Support overall safety program, work closely with Supervisor to improve work-related skills, implement a Performance Development Plan, and document processes and continuously improve Distribution Center Processes.
Archive and make available SOP's and master copies of documents, continuously use and update the priority system, and develop and continuously sharpen a career development plan.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or GED equivalent, Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field (preferred)
